body:
Was this previously working and now you're hitting it with a new version of TensorRT/CUDA ? 
With onnxruntime latest master (which supports TensorRT 7.0), it doesn't hit this issue.

CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_test_all.dir/code/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/test/providers/cpu/tensor/unsqueeze_op_test.cc.o CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_test_all.dir/code/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/test/providers/cpu/tensor/upsample_op_test.cc.o -L/code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release/dnnl/install/lib  -L/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/lib64  -L/usr/local/cuda/targets/x86_64-linux/lib -Wl,-rpath,/code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release/mklml/src/project_mklml/lib:/code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release/dnnl/install/lib:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/lib64:/code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release libonnxruntime_test_utils.a libonnxruntime_session.a libonnxruntime_providers_cuda.a libonnxruntime_providers_dnnl.so libonnxruntime_providers_tensorrt.a libonnxruntime_optimizer.a libonnxruntime_providers.a libonnxruntime_util.a libonnxruntime_framework.a libonnxruntime_graph.a libonnxruntime_common.a libonnxruntime_mlas.a lib/libgtest.a lib/libgmock.a onnx/libonnx.a lib/libgtest.a -lpthread -lcudadevrt -lcudart

make[1]: Leaving directory '/code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release'
No. I remember having other issue when using trt7 and did not continue. This is my first try with trt8

can you provide more details on how to reproduce? build command etc.  you mentioned trt8 above, did you mean trt 7.1 ?
one strange thing with the undefined references you observed is those symbols are from cublasLt , not cublas.
onnxruntime itself doesn't directly depend on cublasLt. so we really shouldn't need to link against it for an indirect dependency.
do you happen to have multiple cuda versions installed on your system?

Ah you're right, trt7.1
It's in a docker environment and I only have cuda 11.

My understanding is that ort should link to the entire dependency tree of share libs, not just direct ones.
`.so` doesn't tell you where it's dependencies come from (except sometimes there's RPATH), so you need to craft that by yourselves.
In cmake, there should be something like:
```
add_library(trt IMPORTED)
target_link_libraries(trt PRIVATE cublas)
target_link_libraries(ort trt)
```
Any news about this issue?

we could never reproduce the issue you reported.
one update.
we added support for TRT 7.1.3 to ORT master and we confirmed https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/dockerfiles/Dockerfile.tensorrt works. 
Can you try to build with the latest master with the build.sh script similar to the Dockerfile above? 
If it continues to repro, to help debug, can you provide a Dockerfile which can reproduce the issue?
Same on master, will check about the dockerfile later.

This seems to be CentOS-only issue. Ubuntu 18.04 works.
Which distro did you use for repro?
Could you try with CentOS 7?

BTW when I try to install master on Ubuntu this line failed:
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/5eec4f66edbfd6441056eed837432a42e191dcd2/cmake/onnxruntime_providers.cmake#L296
Maybe someone forget to check in shared dir?

@jywu-msft
I don't know why it works for you.
Could you check if your link command with `-lnvinfer_plugin` is followed by a cublasLt, or maybe the difference between generated Makefile/Ninja script happens to cover that?
Based on what I found there's no reference to any upstream (w.r.t. trt) dependency in onnx-tensorrt cmake, and `readelf -a` confirmed there's cublasLt symbols in libnvinfer_plugin, so it should not work.
https://github.com/onnx/onnx-tensorrt/blob/088554a5fbee9ba183c05c09c1abe986034e9208/CMakeLists.txt#L113-L115

For now the only solution I came up with is `-DCMAKE_{EXE,SHARED}_LINKER_FLAGS='-Xlinker --allow-shlib-undefined'`, which tells the linker to ignore this bug:
https://github.com/xkszltl/Roaster/commit/1c19614d109f2875cb12e626d0b445f11d7837b7

I had previously posted the full link command above https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/4625#issuecomment-665074722
there is no -lcubasLt
yeah, it's strange why this is encountered on centos but not ubuntu. 
other projects such as onnx-tensorrt directly from nvidia that link against nvinfer_plugin , don't need to additionally link cublasLt
e.g. see https://github.com/onnx/onnx-tensorrt/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L125 and https://github.com/onnx/onnx-tensorrt/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L138

we'll try to investigate further on centos when we have some spare cycles, but a Dockerfile for repro would definitely help expedite.
Actually so far only ubuntu+master works without the fix, centos+master/centos+1.4/ubuntu+1.4 all failed, not sure if there's any randomness.

ubuntu should not fail , since that is what our CI and testing is based on.
i.e. if you use https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/v1.4.0/dockerfiles/Dockerfile.tensorrt and build with
ONNXRUNTIME_BRANCH=v1.4.0 it should be successful.

That only shows that particular path works (and experience from my colleague can also confirm that.)

I don't think distro is the key here.
It is more likely to be a bug that happens to be shadowed under particular configuration.

We don't use the exact same way of build as official build, to make sure we have fine-grain control and make it compatible with all other components in our eco system.
Hope you don't think this is troublesome as it actually help testing out code paths not covered by your CI.

To summarize, here's what we know so far:
1. There's `-lnvinfer_plugin` in link command.
2. `libnvinfer_plugin.so` itself has unresolved cublasLt symbols for sure.
3. There's no `-lcublasLt` after it, meaning there will be unresolved symbol at the end of this command.
4. By default gcc ld reports error about unresolved symbols in shared lib.

i don't think it's troublesome. i agree it could be hiding some underlying issue and should be investigated further.
we would need to spend some time on it to repro with CentOS, but currently we don't have spare cycles.  
i'm pretty certain it doesn't happen on Ubuntu so we would appreciate any help to repro/debug the issue.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale due to inactivity and will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. If further support is needed, please provide an update and/or more details.

@jywu-msft
Any follow up after previous discussion?

> @jywu-msft
> Any follow up after previous discussion?

Unfortunately, not much change since my last update about not having had free cycles to investigate.
The issue has been prioritization vs other tasks. 
For Linux support, we rely on combination of official build process (using build.sh) along with Nvidia provided Docker base image (which is only provided for Ubuntu AFAIK)
are you blocked on this? I was under impression you had a workaround for cmake/centos per previous comments? 
We will revisit in next bugfix planning cycle.

The workaround we applied is to force linking cublasLt to everything.
This kind of hotfix is temporary, we're still blocked in the long term.

This is not a "platform support" issue, it just happen to work for a particular linker and, even in this case, the result binary is still incorrect (containing missing symbols).
Given that the way of fix is clear (add cublasLt as dependency of trt), I don't know why it was de-prioritized.

Besides, we are seeing requests to run it on docker other than Ubuntu/CentOS.
I may be a good idea to improve official build/test coverage.

BTW the official cuda docker already shipped to centos 7 and 8
https://hub.docker.com/layers/nvidia/cuda/11.0-devel-centos7/images/sha256-524efb3d33674f5a1f113140f0c8bab80bb45aa9a5e42a5d0e1f021eee04f9c3?context=explore

As I mentioned, our ORT TensorRT EP dockerfile is based on nvidia's tensorrt base image (which is ubuntu)
so having a cuda base image does not help us here.
If nvidia publishes a centos image for TensorRT, then that would quickly change the situation. 
For the short term, we don't have resources to support an ORT TensorRT EP image based on centos cuda image. We can schedule that work if there is demand for it. Sounds like there is based on your comments.
It would be greatly appreciated if you can help contribute to centos efforts.
A repro (Dockerfile) for this issue on centos would be very helpful.

Btw, I'm not so sure the "way of fix is clear."
I provided an example previously from Nvidia's onnx-tensorrt repo where it does not need to explicitly link cublasLt.
Here are some more examples. 
All the TensorRT sample applications don't seem to link cublasLt either. All the other dependencies are same as what we have.
see https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/master/samples/CMakeSamplesTemplate.txt#L84
interestingly they also have this line: https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/master/samples/CMakeSamplesTemplate.txt#L113
which is the same as the --allow-shlib-undefined you tried previously.
The comment above it also calls out libnvinfer_plugin library specifically.
I don't know why we don't need this. Maybe because we don't actually use symbols from libnvinfer_plugin.
Again, this is why I am requesting a repro. It feels like our build environments are different and it would help us if we didn't have to reproduce an environment that is not our primary supported setup.

update on this.  I tested on centos 7 nvidia container and onnxruntime TensorRT EP builds without any issues.
here are the components I used
*  latest ORT master branch
*  nvidia/cuda:11.0-cudnn8-devel-centos7 image
*  TensorRT-7.1.3.4.CentOS-7.6.x86_64-gnu.cuda-11.0.cudnn8.0.tar.gz from nvidia tensorrt download page
*  gcc 8.3.1 from devtoolset-8
*  cmake 3.14.4
*  build command: ./build.sh --config Release --update --build --build_shared_lib --parallel --skip_submodule_sync --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home /tensorrt/TensorRT-7.1.3.4 --cuda_home /usr/local/cuda --cudnn_home /usr

The old codebase from back in July had tensorrt ep as shared lib, but was implicitly linking tensorrt ep to onnxruntime_test_all
I think that might have caused some problems. with EP as shared lib, ORT will explicitly load EP shared libs.

> Btw, I'm not so sure the "way of fix is clear."

You can blindly link to cublaslt if trt libs ask for it, just as what I did for workaround.
This is static info that you can see with `readelf -a`.
The first line already tells you `libnvinfer_plugin.so` **NEED** `libcublasLt.so`.
```
$ readelf -a /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libnvinfer_plugin.so.7.2.1 | grep -i cublaslt

  0ec:   3 (GLIBC_2.2.5)  16 (CXXABI_1.3.8)   8 (libcublasLt.so.11)   5 (GLIBCXX_3.4)

  11c:   0 (*local*)       c (CXXABI_1.3)    8 (libcublasLt.so.11)   3 (GLIBC_2.2.5)
  124:   e (GLIBCXX_3.4.9)   8 (libcublasLt.so.11)  18 (GLIBC_2.3)     5 (GLIBCXX_3.4)
  12c:   6 (libcublas.so.11)   0 (*local*)       8 (libcublasLt.so.11)   c (CXXABI_1.3) 
  134:   0 (*local*)       3 (GLIBC_2.2.5)   5 (GLIBCXX_3.4)   8 (libcublasLt.so.11)
  0x0080: Version: 1  File: libcublasLt.so.11  Cnt: 1
  0x0090:   Name: libcublasLt.so.11  Flags: none  Version: 8
```
You don't need to rely on runtime info or repro to figure this out.

> I provided an example previously from Nvidia's onnx-tensorrt repo where it does not need to explicitly link cublasLt.
Here are some more examples.
All the TensorRT sample applications don't seem to link cublasLt either. All the other dependencies are same as what we have.
see https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/master/samples/CMakeSamplesTemplate.txt#L84
interestingly they also have this line: https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT/blob/master/samples/CMakeSamplesTemplate.txt#L113
which is the same as the --allow-shlib-undefined you tried previously.

They probably massed up.
Or they have some internal knowledge about it why intentionally providing incomplete dependencies.
Maybe they're very sure that it won't be called.

> The old codebase from back in July had tensorrt ep as shared lib, but was implicitly linking tensorrt ep to onnxruntime_test_all
I think that might have caused some problems. with EP as shared lib, ORT will explicitly load EP shared libs.

If it's dynamically loaded, the issue is probably "shadowed" again, since loader doesn't do that symbol check for you.
I didn't see it in v1.5.3.

Note that
- The issue is still there, but delayed to a segfault instead of linking error, if code path to those symbol is ever touched.
- Unlike native loader, dotnet's special loader will treat unresolved symbol as fatal error during loading.

Interesting, trt 7.1 doesn't have the `NEEDED` line as in trt 7.2.
```
$ readelf -a /usr/lib64/libnvinfer_plugin.so.7.1.3 | grep -i cublaslt
```

Emmm strange....I cannot repro it with our latest environment either, regardless of which version of trt/cuda I used.

exactly. if you look at the very first comment of this issue, your output snapshot shows that the build failed for onnxruntime_test_all which is the unit test program. there should be no undefined references to cublasLt there. 
I believe it was due to an overlink issue that created the undefined cublasLt symbols in the main program.
If all the dependent shared libs that need cublasLt symbols are linked correctly, then the main program should not also need to link to cublasLt directly.
closing issue.
